alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 12:48PM MST until July 14 at 4:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AREAS NEAR JEROME AND COTTONWOOD....IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Near the communities of Jerome and Cottonwood in Yavapai County. * WHEN...Until 345 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks, normally dry washes, and small streams is imminent or occurring. Dangerous flooding over low-water crossings. Water flowing over roadways will create slick paved roads and muddy unpaved roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1246 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Rapid river rises will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Oak Wash, Ash Creek, Verde River, Oak Creek, Blowout Creek, Cherry Creek, Munds Draw, Coyote Spring and Bitter Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Clarkdale, Cottonwood, Verde Village, Bridgeport, Jerome, Mingus Mountain Campground, Playground Group Campground, Tuzigoot National Monument, Dead Horse Ranch State Park and Potato Patch Campground. - This includes the following highways... State Route 89A between mile markers 332 and 358. State Route 260 between mile markers 207 and 212.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well.
